sentences.text: General elections were held in Greenland on 11 March 2025 to elect the 31 members of the Inatsisartut. The opposition Democrats (Greenland)|Democrats won a Plurality (voting)|plurality of ten seats.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite news |last=Hyldal |first=Christine |date=4 February 2025 |title=Múte B. Egede opfordrer til valg 11. marts - og sådan bliver det |url=https://knr.gl/da/nyheder/mute-b-egede-opfordrer-til-valg-11-marts-og-saadan-bliver-det |publisher=Kalaallit Nunaata Radioa |lang=da}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.dw.com/en/demokraatit-wins-greenland-for-parliamentary-election/a-71884152|title=Demokraatit wins Greenland parliamentary election|date=11 March 2025|first=Shubhangi|last=Derhgawen|publisher=DW}}</ref>

sentences.text: Greenlandic independence|Independence was the most important issue of the election. The government declared in February 2024 that independence was its goal. At a press conference in early 2025, pro-independence prime minister Múte Bourup Egede said that "work has already begun on creating the framework for Greenland as an independent state" and apparently hinted that an independence referendum could take place in April 2025, in tandem with the election. In addition to the five parties already represented in the Inatsisartut, a new sixth party with a primary focus on Greenlandic independence, Qulleq (political party)|Qulleq, gained ballot access a month before the election.

references.text: <ref name="cp20250108">{{Cite news |date=8 January 2025 |title=Greenland's Premier will visit Denmark's king after all |url=https://cphpost.dk/2025-01-08/general/greenlands-premier-cancel-will-visit-denmarks-king-after-all/ |access-date=8 January 2025 |work=Copenhagen Post |archive-date=10 January 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250110104325/https://cphpost.dk/2025-01-08/general/greenlands-premier-cancel-will-visit-denmarks-king-after-all/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref name="gray20241125">{{Cite news |last=Gray |first=Alexander B. |date=25 November 2024 |title=Why Trump Really Should 'Buy' Greenland |url=https://www.wsj.com/opinion/why-trump-really-should-buy-greenland-national-security-policy-58d9c2ca |archive-url=https://archive.today/20241126224539/https://www.wsj.com/opinion/why-trump-really-should-buy-greenland-national-security-policy-58d9c2ca |archive-date=26 November 2024|access-date=23 December 2024 |work=The Wall Street Journal |language=en-US}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |date=3 January 2025 |title=Greenland's leader wants independence from Denmark as Trump hovers over Arctic island |url=https://www.politico.eu/article/greenland-prime-minister-mute-egede-independence-denmark-colonialism-donald-trump-arctic/ |access-date=6 January 2025 |website=Politico|language=en-GB}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |date=3 January 2025 |title=Greenland's PM pushes for independence from Denmark |url=https://www.euronews.com/my-europe/2025/01/03/greenlands-pm-pushes-for-independence-from-denmark-amid-trumps-interest |access-date=6 January 2025 |website=Euronews |language=en}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.sermitsiaq.ag/samfund/partiet-qulleq-klar-til-at-stille-op/2193745|title=Partiet Qulleq klar til at stille op|newspaper=Sermitsiaq (newspaper)|Sermitsiaq|date=7 February 2025|first=Jensine|last=Berthelsen|lang=da}}</ref>

sentences.text: However, after American president-elect Proposed United States acquisition of Greenland|Donald Trump renewed his interest in Greenland, Egede played down any notion of immediate independence and instead stressed the need for reforms of the cooperation between the governments of Denmark and Greenland at a press conference in Copenhagen on 10 January 2025. In an interview on Fox News on 16 January, Egede stated that Greenlanders have no wish to become a part of the U.S., and an opinion poll that month showed 85% of those surveyed opposed the proposal with 6% in favour and 9% unsure. In the leadup to the election, the opposition leader Jens Frederik Nielsen (Democrats (Greenland)|Democrats) spoke in support for complete independence, telling Sky News that Greenland is "not for sale." In a final televised debate before the day before the election, the leaders of all five parties represented in the Inatsisartut voiced their distrust of Trump; only Karl Ingemann, leader of Qulleq, voiced trust in Trump.

references.text: <ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.dr.dk/nyheder/indland/groenlaenderne-vil-ikke-vaere-danskere-eller-amerikanere-her-er-de-vigtigste-pointer|title=Grønlænderne vil ikke være danskere - eller amerikanere: Her er de vigtigste pointer fra pressemøde|website=DR|date=10 January 2025}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.foxnews.com/media/greenlands-prime-minister-says-arctic-island-doesnt-want-part-us-always-strong-partner|title=Greenland's prime minister says Arctic island doesn't want to be part of the US: 'Always be a strong partner'|website=Fox News|date=16 January 2025}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |date=2025-01-29 |title=Greenlanders overwhelmingly oppose becoming part of the United States, poll shows |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/poll-shows-85-greenlanders-do-not-want-be-part-us-2025-01-29/ |website=Reuters}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news |last1=Waghorn |first1=Dominic |title=President Trump is forcing Greenlanders to confront their future |url=https://news.sky.com/story/president-trump-is-forcing-greenlanders-to-confront-their-future-13326109 |access-date=12 March 2025 |work=Sky News |date=11 March 2025}}</ref>

<ref name=NYT>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2025/03/12/world/europe/greenland-election.html|date=March 12, 2023|newspaper=New York Times|title=In Trump's Shadow, Greenland Votes for a New Government|first1=Christian Ulloriaq|last1=Jeppesen|first2=Maya|last2=Tekeli|first3=Jeffrey|last3=Gettleman}}</ref>

sentences.text: Separate to the issue of independence, the economy was also an important theme, with debate over how is best to support commerce and industry, and ultimately strengthen the Greenlandic economy. Other issues included Greenland's relationship with international climate agreements, the functioning of the health care system, and social problems related to high house prices and homelessness.

references.text: <ref>[https://www.information.dk/indland/2025/02/groenlandsk-chefredaktoer-nuancerne-forsvinder-naar-kun-yderpolerne-kommer-orde? Grønlandsk chefredaktør: »Nuancerne forsvinder, når kun yderpolerne kommer til orde«. Artikel på information.dk 16. februar 2025.]</ref>

sentences.text: In the run-up to the election, the Danish Security and Intelligence Service and the Danish Defence Intelligence Service announced they were actively monitoring for potential attempts by foreign powers to influence the outcome of the Greenlandic elections. In an interview with TV 2 (Danish TV channel)|TV 2, independent analysts named the United States, Russia and China as possible instigators of Clandestine operation|clandestine action in the country.

references.text: <ref name="tv22"/><ref>{{cite news |last1=Hivert |first1=Anne-Françoise |title=Greenland prepares for risks of foreign interference |url=https://www.lemonde.fr/en/international/article/2025/02/05/greenland-rallies-against-the-risk-of-foreign-interference_6737789_4.html |access-date=March 4, 2025 |work=Le Monde |date=February 5, 2025 |archive-date=7 March 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250307004603/https://www.lemonde.fr/en/international/article/2025/02/05/greenland-rallies-against-the-risk-of-foreign-interference_6737789_4.html |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref name="tv22">{{cite news |title=Eksperter frygter desinformation og udenlandsk indblanding – "ser det allerede" |url=https://nyheder.tv2.dk/politik/2025-02-04-eksperter-frygter-desinformation-og-udenlandsk-indblanding-ser-det-allerede |access-date=February 5, 2025 |work=TV 2 |date=February 5, 2025}}</ref>

sentences.text: The 31 members of the Inatsisartut are elected by open list proportional representation in a single nationwide constituency. Seats are allocated using the d'Hondt method. While there is no formal threshold, parties need around 3% of total votes to gain seats.

references.text: <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.electionguide.org/elections/id/2825/|title=Election Profile|website=IFES Election Guide|access-date=25 November 2024|archive-date=4 December 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141204194739/http://www.electionguide.org/elections/id/2825/|url-status=live}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |date=11 March 2025 |title=Grønland har ingen formel spærregrænse |url=https://www.kristeligt-dagblad.dk/danmark/liveblog-groenlaenderne-gaar-til-valg |access-date=11 March 2025 |language=da}}</ref>

sentences.text: The two governing parties, Inuit Ataqatigiit and Siumut, lost a combined 31 percentage points of the vote, marking a historic defeat for a Greenlandic coalition government similar to other democracies after the COVID-19 pandemic. The centre-right opposition Democrats won the most seats for the first time in its history, likely going to coalition with one of the two currently governing parties, though environmental policies in relation to mining may be an issue that vaults Naleraq into government.

references.text: <ref name="auto3">{{Cite news |last=Burn-Murdoch |first=John |date=2024-11-07 |title=Democrats join 2024's graveyard of incumbents |url=https://www.ft.com/content/e8ac09ea-c300-4249-af7d-109003afb893 |access-date=2025-03-12 |work=Financial Times |archive-date=7 November 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20241107180858/https://www.ft.com/content/e8ac09ea-c300-4249-af7d-109003afb893 |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref name="auto2">{{Cite web|first=Cooper|last=Burton |title=Democrats aren't alone — incumbent parties have lost elections all around the world |url=https://abcnews.go.com/538/democrats-incumbent-parties-lost-elections-world/story?id=115972068 |access-date=2025-03-12 |website=ABC News |language=en |archive-date=20 November 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20241120015856/https://abcnews.go.com/538/democrats-incumbent-parties-lost-elections-world/story?id=115972068 |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref name="auto">{{Cite web |date=2024-11-17 |title=The 'super year' of elections has been super bad for incumbents as voters punish them in droves |url=https://apnews.com/article/global-elections-2024-incumbents-defeated-c80fbd4e667de86fe08aac025b333f95 |access-date=2025-03-12 |website=AP News|first1=David|last1=Rising|first2=Jill|last2=Lawless|first3=Nicholas|last3=Riccardi |language=en |archive-date=20 November 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20241120032340/https://apnews.com/article/global-elections-2024-incumbents-defeated-c80fbd4e667de86fe08aac025b333f95 |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref name="auto1">{{Cite web |last=Brawn |first=Steph |date=2025-03-12 |title=Surprise result in Greenland as centre-right party wins elections |url=https://www.thenational.scot/news/25001388.shock-result-greenland-centre-right-party-wins-elections/ |access-date=2025-03-12 |website=The National |language=en}}</ref>

<ref name=":1">{{Cite news |date=2025-03-12 |title=Greenland votes for economic reforms |url=https://www.bangkokpost.com/world/2978601/greenland-votes-for-economic-reforms |access-date=2025-03-13 |work=Bangkok Post |language=en}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite news |last=Jaeger |first=Toef |date=2025-03-12 |title=Verkiezingsuitslag Groenland toont einde aan stabiliteit |url=https://www.nrc.nl/nieuws/2025/03/12/verkiezingsuitslag-groenland-toont-einde-aan-stabiliteit-a4886060 |access-date=2025-03-13 |work=NRC |language=nl-NL}}</ref>

sentences.text: Inuit Ataqatigiit had been expected to win the election but instead suffered a significant decline. Originally dissatisfaction with Denmark over the spiral case dominated political feelings in Greenland, however fear of losing autonomy to the United States took more importance as the election progressed, especially after US President Donald Trump stated he would not rule out taking the island by force. Qulleq (political party)|Qulleq, the newest party and the only one with a leader to voice trust in Trump, failed to win a single seat, receiving 305 votes. Kuno Fencker, a Naleraq MP, told ''The Guardian'' that "Before, people voted mostly Siumut – it was like a football club that they never left. But people have had enough and voted very differently this time."

references.text: <ref name="AP">{{cite web |last1=Kirka |first1=Danica |date=12 March 2025 |title=Greenland's election winners push back against Trump's wish to take control of the island |url=https://apnews.com/article/greenland-election-demokraatit-trump-arctic-13c295cbc716db2c8011be5819e11fef |access-date=12 March 2025 |website=Associated Press}}</ref>

<ref name=":0"/> Nielsen, leader of the winning Democrats, stated that the results should be a clear message to the United States and Trump that "We don’t want to be Americans. No, we don’t want to be Danes. We want to be Greenlanders. And we want our own independence in the future. And we want to build our own country by ourselves, not with his hope."<ref name="AP"/> Pele Broberg, leader of runner-up Naleraq, suggested in an op-ed to USNews that Greenland could take advantage of the situation to gain leverage in succession talks and maybe even gain Associated state|free association status, similar to Federated States of Micronesia|Micronesia or Palau's Compact of Free Association|association with the United States, to deal with the lack of military protection from Denmark that would happen upon independence.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Greenland to get new government to lead independence process|work=Raw Story |url=https://www.rawstory.com/greenland-to-get-new-government-to-lead-independence-process/|date=12 March 2025 |access-date=13 March 2025 |language=en}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |last=Broberg |first=Pelé |date=March 10, 2025 |title=I'm Running to Lead Greenland. Trump Is Right That Denmark Has Got to Go. |url=https://www.usnews.com/opinion/articles/2025-03-10/trump-greenland-minerals-oil-gas-independence-election |access-date=March 12, 2025 |website=USNews}}</ref>

<ref name=NYT/>
 
Numerous areas where Siumut has traditionally been the strongest force, especially the villages, fell to Naleraq, a party which is popular with fishermen and hunters and takes the strongest pro-independence stance, while Demokraatit won numerous votes in the cities previously dominated by Inuit Ataqatigiit. The election result was interpreted as indicating that solving Greenland's internal social and economic problems took priority over achieving independence as quickly as possible. It was suspected that the extensive nationalization and monopolization, as well as the associated fisheries policy, had caused resentment among the population, who wanted a more liberal approach, while others were demonstrating their dissatisfaction with Denmark by voting for Naleraq.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Mogensen |first=Lars Trier |date=2025-03-12 |title=Blåt protestvalg i Grønland |url=https://www.information.dk/indland/2025/03/blaat-protestvalg-groenland |access-date=2025-03-12 |website=Information |language=da}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite news |last=Bryant |first=Miranda |date=2025-03-12 |title=Greenland election: Democrat party wins surprise victory amid spectre of Trump |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2025/mar/12/greenland-election-opposition-democrat-party-wins-surprise-victory-amid-spectre-of-trump |access-date=2025-03-13 |work=The Guardian |language=en-GB |issn=0261-3077}}</ref>

sentences.text: Danish Defense Minister Troels Lund Poulsen congratulated the Democrats and said that the future of Greenland is up to Greenlanders, not the United States, while Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen also congratulated the Democrats calling the results "a celebration of democracy."

references.text: <ref name="AP"/> On 20 March, the Danish Defence Intelligence Service and the Danish Police Intelligence Service said that it had not found evidence of a systematic and coordinated campaign by a foreign government or foreign intelligence service to influence the election, while acknowledging that there was rampant misinformation on social media, including the creation of fake profiles pretending to be Danish or Greenlandic politicians and dissemination of false or manipulated information.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2025-03-20 |title=No evidence of foreign state influence on Greenland’s election, Denmark says |url=https://apnews.com/article/greenland-election-denmark-influence-misinformation-e1ac21dac2121b9caee0131e22a81415 |access-date=2025-03-20 |website=AP News |language=en}}</ref>

sentences.text: Erik Jensen (Greenlandic politician)|Erik Jensen, leader of junior coalition partner Siumut resigned the day after the election.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |last=Veirum |first=Thomas Munk |date=2025-03-12 |title=Erik Jensen trækker sig efter sviende valgnederlag |url=https://www.sermitsiaq.ag/samfund/erik-jensen-traekker-sig-efter-sviende-valgnederlag/2208012 |access-date=2025-03-12 |website=Sermitsiaq |language=da-DK}}</ref>

sentences.text: On 27 March 2025, the newspaper ''Sermitsiaq (newspaper)|Sermitsiaq'' reported that a coalition agreement between all parties that won seats in the Inatsisartut, with the exception of Naleraq, had been reached. The coalition government was unveiled the next day, with Jens-Frederik Nielsen of the Democrats as its head.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |date=2025-03-28 |title=Greenland lawmakers form a new government on the eve of Vance visit |url=https://apnews.com/article/greenland-us-trump-vance-coalition-government-7761811a2fc02d1ae86bb09e16b4bd46 |access-date=2025-03-28 |website=AP News |language=en}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |date=2025-03-28 |title=Greenland forms new government hours before visit by US Vice President Vance |url=https://www.rappler.com/world/europe/greenland-forms-new-government-before-jd-vance-visit/ |access-date=2025-03-28 |website=Rappler |language=en}}</ref>
